Branch `hitl_usability` has a custom colors feature implemented already. I plan on making it the next pull request. The 6 default colors remain hard-coded though, not only on the palette but on each of the inspectors (wall, stairs, level), which is really really bad.

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick colors from the palette and assign on 3D view

content.raw:
Ahh, okay, that's not what I'm seeing.

![wall_progression.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2783597306-wall_progression.png)

1. An unselected (transparent) blue wall.
2. An selected (opaque) blue wall.
3. An blue wall that is hovered over by an orange color mouse.
4. An opaque orange wall.
5. A transparent orange wall.

This is a pretty subtle difference, but 3 and 4 look different to me. Specifically, 3 looks like a mixture of blue and orange.

You can repeat it with a white wall hovered over with a dark color mouse (blue works pretty well) and you'll see that the middle step looks like a lighter shade of the color.
content.html:
Ahh, okay, that's not what I'm seeing.

  1. An unselected (transparent) blue wall.
  2. An selected (opaque) blue wall.
  3. An blue wall that is hovered over by an orange color mouse.
  4. An opaque orange wall.
  5. A transparent orange wall.

This is a pretty subtle difference, but 3 and 4 look different to me. Specifically, 3 looks like a mixture of blue and orange.

You can repeat it with a white wall hovered over with a dark color mouse (blue works pretty well) and you'll see that the middle step looks like a lighter shade of the color.

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick colors from the palette and assign on 3D view

content.raw:
Agh, I was still getting crashes after exiting the building editor, reentering and mousing over the 2D view. I think there was something weird with `QGraphicsItem::setVisible`. If a QGraphicsItem is invisible, then it does not accept events (see documentation [here](http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-4.8/qgraphicsitem.html#setVisible)). Also, if a QGraphicsItem parent toggles visibility/invisibility, its children also go visible/invisible. I think one of these facts was causing segfaults for me (maybe it was trying to set the visibility of mouseTooltip's children, which are NULL?)

I have a branch where I got rid of all calls to `QGraphicsItem::setVisible` and instead added/removed the mouseTooltip to the scene: hitl_color_mouse_novisibility.
content.html:
Agh, I was still getting crashes after exiting the building editor, reentering and mousing over the 2D view. I think there was something weird with QGraphicsItem::setVisible. If a QGraphicsItem is invisible, then it does not accept events (see documentation here). Also, if a QGraphicsItem parent toggles visibility/invisibility, its children also go visible/invisible. I think one of these facts was causing segfaults for me (maybe it was trying to set the visibility of mouseTooltip's children, which are NULL?)

I have a branch where I got rid of all calls to QGraphicsItem::setVisible and instead added/removed the mouseTooltip to the scene: hitl_color_mouse_novisibility.
